page.title: 17A FARMER'S DAY
page.content: The farmer usually gets up at about 6.30am and walks around his cattle and other livestock.He usually then has breakfast & decides what to do for the rest of the day.In the winter it may be ploughing or seeding or any maintenance job.In the spring & summer it is usually looking after the young animals or new crops and later it is harvesting.Much of his time is now spent in looking after the machinery which costs many thousands of pounds. After lunch sometimes he takes his wife to the town where she shops while he goes to different stockists.The farmer we talked to enjoyed the evening best because he often walked around his property looking at the new animals or growing crops.He said he could think of nothing better than the job he had.
